div.h3: Provided by the APR Specials Team for your hearts, minds, bodies, and spirits during responsible #socialdistancing and #virtuallearning throughout our closure.

div.style: background-size: cover; background-position: center center; background-image: url(https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/kEZXBtbnoL1zVqM18YlzoyXITduO2P38xVmMYtB1dAUXDUj8fJbh4QfdbDMTm_dJEwwJsYF7=w16383);

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-qWD73c jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: >>> Live Specials Class Pages Are HERE!

div.small: Stay tuned for details for LIVE Zoom Sessions.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: font-family: Roboto Slab; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-Clt0zb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: We hope you all are able to and have chosen to be at home at this time. As we navigate this uncertain time together (while apart), we'll be doing our best to provide wellness resources for students, staff/faculty, and families. Please check back to this site for additions to daily activities, fitness challenges, videos, and suggested resources for all.

This might be a time in which people are feeling anxious, fearful, lost, bored, confused, and also sort of curious about what they might be able to do with all of this unscheduled time... All of those feelings are valid and normal. It may take some time to get into a groove and find our stride, but it will happen. WE ARE RESILIENT.
Please take a few minutes to explore the MENU bar - the is a lot there. (And the site works best when viewed on a laptop).

span.strong: In addition to this site, please (VIRTUALLY) seek out resources and people who you feel can provide guidance, calm, ideas (!), and perspective.

div.p: Be well, care about and connect with each other (virtually), and please #socialdistance responsibly; it's the most CARING thing you can do for the most medically vulnerable people in our communities.

div.p: * Students, please check in with your ADVISORS and trusted adults frequently! We want to hear from you!
